article_title: Jacksonville's Joe McLaughlin campaigns for N.C. Insurance Commissioner's seat
article_text:
Daily News Staff Follow @michaeleetodd By Michael Todd Daily News Staff

Posted Mar. 8, 2016 at 10:00 AM

Updated Mar 10, 2016 at 11:09 AM

article_metadata.description:
A Jacksonville financial planner and retired soldier will face two other Army veterans — a contractor and insurance agent and insurance-agency owner — vying for the N.C. insurance commissioner’s seat during the GOP primary March 15.
Joe McLaughlin said he is the only Republican candidate who works in the insurance industry.
He will face Republicans Mike Causey of Guilford County and Ronald Pierce of Mecklenburg County.
As to what he is learning on his campaign, McLaughlin
article_metadata.author: Michael Todd
